title: Partnership and Capital Raising via RIQ – AI-Native Reinsurance Platform
description: IHC, in partnership with BlackRock and Lunate, launched RIQ, an ADGM-based global reinsurance platform backed by over USD 1bn in equity and targeting USD 10bn+ in liabilities. This platform is open to innovative partners in AI, risk analysis, and capital investment, aiming to reshape global reinsurance through advanced technology.
example: Global InsurTechs or AI companies can integrate advanced analytics, fraud detection, or data ingestion tools into RIQ. Institutional investors, pension funds, or sovereign wealth funds can allocate capital for global exposure to AI-powered reinsurance, while traditional reinsurers could provide capacity and co-insurance products for diversification and risk pooling.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify AI or FinTech partners for technology collaboration or data analytics modules.
Step 2: Develop integration pilots and performance benchmarks.
Step 3: Initiate partnerships with institutional investors for capital allocation.
Step 4: Roll out bundled or white-label reinsurance products via RIQ, leveraging global distribution channels.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Dirham-Backed Stablecoin Development & Blockchain Payment Partnership
description: IHC, ADQ, and First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB) are collaborating to launch a UAE Dirham-backed stablecoin to enhance digital payments and promote blockchain innovation. Partners in blockchain, payment gateways, compliance, and e-commerce may cooperate to scale adoption and expand use-cases.
example: International payment processors and fintechs could integrate the Dirham stablecoin to enable instant cross-border settlements for UAE-based retailers. Blockchain compliance technology providers can develop KYC/AML modules, while regional e-commerce and travel platforms can accept the new stablecoin as payment, tapping into local digital liquidity.
roadmap: Step 1: Partner with blockchain and payment gateway companies for integration.
Step 2: Develop merchant tools and API documentation for stablecoin acceptance.
Step 3: Launch a pilot program with early adopter retailers and e-commerce platforms.
Step 4: Expand regulatory guidelines and cross-border settlement corridors.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Participation in Gridora Infrastructure Platform with ADQ & Modon
description: IHC, ADQ, and Modon Holding created Gridora: a national infrastructure platform to accelerate strategic projects across UAE and globally. Engineering, construction, Clean Tech, and IoT companies can join as suppliers, co-developers, or technology providers.
example: Clean tech firms could supply smart grids, solar panels, or EV infrastructure for Gridora projects. Engineering and construction companies, especially with digital twin or advanced logistics expertise, can become preferred contractors or JV partners for large-scale development across UAE, London, and other international targets.
roadmap: Step 1: Qualify vendors and identify strategic technology solution providers.
Step 2: Pilot integration of smart infrastructure and clean-tech systems on new projects.
Step 3: Form joint bids with engineering or real estate partners for international expansions.
Step 4: Build a marketplace or preferred vendor program for ongoing supplier engagement.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: M&A and Investment Entry in European Fashion Retail with Multiply Group
description: IHC’s subsidiary Multiply Group acquired 67.91% of Tendam, a major European fashion retail company. Global fashion brands, logistics providers, and retail tech companies can seek partnership or expansion approaches into new regional markets leveraging Tendam’s established network.
example: Emerging fashion brands in Asia or MENA can partner to access European store distribution through Tendam. Retail tech providers can offer POS, omnichannel software, or customer analytics for Tendam’s stores, leveraging Multiply Group’s scale and retail expansion agenda.
roadmap: Step 1: Conduct partner due diligence and identify fashion or technology providers seeking entry to Europe.
Step 2: Structure distribution or technology partnerships with Tendam.
Step 3: Execute joint marketing campaigns in new markets.
Step 4: Expand partnerships to additional product categories or digital channels.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: SME Financing Partnerships with Zelo (formerly eFunder)
description: IHC acquired and rebranded the invoice financing platform eFunder as Zelo, addressing the USD 250bn UAE SME credit gap with digital-first solutions. Fintechs, banks, accounting software providers, and B2B marketplaces can partner for embedded finance offerings or SME origination.
example: Corporate procurement platforms can embed Zelo invoice financing for suppliers. Regional banks can partner for co-lending or shared risk pools, and fintech APIs can enable automated invoice receivable validation, accelerating SME lending decisions.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify B2B platforms and fintech partners for integration.
Step 2: Develop joint onboarding flows and API connections.
Step 3: Launch co-branded financing offers to SME clients.
Step 4: Expand product range (e.g., supply chain finance, working capital solutions).
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Strategic Partnerships in Healthcare Expansion with PureHealth and Hellenic Healthcare Group
description: PureHealth, part of IHC, acquired a 60% stake in Greece’s largest private healthcare provider, Hellenic Healthcare Group, for USD 2.3bn. Healthcare technology providers, pharmaceutical companies, and medical device firms can cooperate to supply, digitize, or enhance the expanded hospital network.
example: European and MENA-based MedTech companies can introduce new devices or digital health solutions through Hellenic Healthcare’s facilities. Pharmaceutical companies could establish preferred supplier relationships to access Greek and GCC markets. Health IT companies can collaborate for telemedicine or hospital information systems.
roadmap: Step 1: Map key needs of the expanded healthcare network.
Step 2: Qualify MedTech and health tech partners for pilots.
Step 3: Structure clinical or commercial partnerships for new product launches.
Step 4: Pursue co-innovation grants or regional R&D collaborations.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Renewable Energy Ecosystem Collaboration via Esyasoft & Good Energy Acquisition
description: IHC’s Esyasoft acquired Good Energy, a UK-based renewable energy and EV tech company. CleanTech, EV charging, and grid management companies can partner to deploy, scale, or co-innovate on renewables and electric mobility in UAE, UK, or new markets.
example: Electric vehicle (EV) charging station manufacturers and software providers can partner with Good Energy to expand network installations in the UK or bring EV tech and grid management tools into the GCC. Renewable component suppliers (solar, storage) can offer joint solutions to urban infrastructure developers across both markets.
roadmap: Step 1: Evaluate market entry opportunities for renewable and EV technologies.
Step 2: Establish commercial pilots with local authorities or real estate owners.
Step 3: Scale successful projects using joint marketing and bulk procurement.
Step 4: Jointly seek national or regional decarbonization grants and incentives.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2

title: Joint Ventures or Contracting with NMDC Group and Emdad for Oilfield Services
description: NMDC Group, another IHC subsidiary, acquired a 70% stake in Emdad, expanding into recurring OPEX-driven oilfield services business with significant revenue. Oil & gas technology companies, asset monitoring firms, and logistics providers can partner for service delivery, digitalization, or regional expansion.
example: Oilfield IoT and digital twin solution providers can offer predictive maintenance technologies to Emdad for recurring contracts. Logistics companies specializing in MENA infrastructure can support Emdad’s equipment delivery and onsite service efficiency.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify technology and logistics needs across Emdad’s service contracts.
Step 2: Launch pilot projects with selected technology or supply chain partners.
Step 3: Expand service offerings to new regions via joint venture or subcontracting structure.
Step 4: Create integrated digital dashboards and real-time performance tracking for clients.
source_name: Ihc Delivers Significant Growth In H1 2025 With Aed 547 Billion Revenue And Aed 108 Billion Net Profit Driven By Strategic Investments And A High Performing Q2
